revised_title: Advances in Surface Science: Electron Spectroscopy and Kinetics
tldr: This article discusses recent trends in surface science, focusing on electron spectroscopy and its applications in understanding adsorption, kinetics, and catalysis. The authors explore various topics, including subsurface adsorption, molecular beam results, ethylene hydrogenation, and the evolution of catalytic entities. They also highlight the importance of single-crystal planes in providing accurate and reproducible data in surface science studies.
